Detailed Description

A class representing an endpoint on a UsbInterface.

Endpoints are the channels for sending and receiving data over USB. Typically bulk endpoints are used for sending non-trivial amounts of data. Interrupt endpoints are used for sending small amounts of data, typically events, separately from the main data streams. The endpoint zero is a special endpoint for control messages sent from the host to device. Isochronous endpoints are currently unsupported.

int32_t gaia::usb::UsbEndpoint::getAddress ( )

Returns the endpoint's address field.

The address is a bitfield containing both the endpoint number as well as the data direction of the endpoint. the endpoint number and direction can also be accessed via getEndpointNumber and getDirection.

Returns:
the endpoint's address
int32_t gaia::usb::UsbEndpoint::getAttributes ( )

Returns the endpoint's attributes field.

Returns:
the endpoint's attributes
UsbConstants gaia::usb::UsbEndpoint::getDirection ( )

Returns the endpoint's direction.

Returns UsbConstants#USB_DIR_OUT if the direction is host to device, and UsbConstants#USB_DIR_IN if the direction is device to host.

See also:
UsbConstants#USB_DIR_IN
UsbConstants#USB_DIR_OUT
Returns:
the endpoint's direction

int32_t gaia::usb::UsbEndpoint::getMaxPacketSize ( )

Returns the endpoint's maximum packet size.

Returns:
the endpoint's maximum packet size
UsbConstants gaia::usb::UsbEndpoint::getType ( )

Returns the endpoint's type.

Possible results are:

  • UsbConstants#USB_ENDPOINT_XFER_CONTROL (endpoint zero)
  • UsbConstants#USB_ENDPOINT_XFER_ISOC (isochronous endpoint)
  • UsbConstants#USB_ENDPOINT_XFER_BULK (bulk endpoint)
  • UsbConstants#USB_ENDPOINT_XFER_INT (interrupt endpoint)
Returns:
the endpoint's type
